DOC.brief_summary: Purpose : assess efficacy physical training program patient ankylose spondylitis ( AS ) randomize control study
DOC.detailed_description: AS chronic inflammatory rheumatic disorder affect spine , peripheral joint entheses . Patients undergo pain , stiffness reduce mobility spine joint . Patients experience limitation physical activity reduce quality life . Some uncontrolled study report benefit physical activity patient AS . The aim present study assess efficacy physical training program patient AS . Patients randomize two parallel arm : program personalize physical training ( intervention group [ PEPc ] ) program information physical activity ( control group [ PIAP ] ) . Patients evaluate 12 24 week activity , functional metrological score ( ASAS 20 , ASAS 5/6 , ASDAS , BASDAI , BASFI , BASMI ) ; biological inflammation ( CRP ) ; NSAID use pain VAS . Primary outcome : percentage patient reach ASAS 20 response 12 week . Secondary outcome : ASAS 20 24 week , ASAS5/6 , ASDAS , BASDAI , BASFI , BASMI , CRP , NSAID use pain VAS 12 24 week . Statistical analysis : comparison percentage patient reach ASAS 20 response 12 week arm use Fisher 's exact test ( main outcome ) .
DOC.criteria: Patients AS accord ASAS criterion , treat NSAID , synthetic DMARD antiTNF agent . Contraindications physical training program ( e.g . cardiac failure , pregnancy , painful arthroplasty lower limb damage joint ) .
